recommendations: Chaine Leaps is a series of jumps in which the skater alternates between the front and back legs.. For practicing Chaine Leaps as a/an amateur performance, the recommended warm-up exercises are Chaine turns, Skips, Leap preparations for 3 repetitions for 5 minutes. After warming up, you should practice the following instructions: Start in B-plus position., Perform a chaine turn., Push off the back leg, leaping forward., Land on the front leg, bending knees., Repeat with the opposite leg. for 3 repetitions for 5 minutes. Since you want to particularly focus on stability, additional exercises could include Plank holds, Single-leg balance, Bosu ball balance.

Hitch Kick is a jump in which the skater kicks the back leg forward, then lands on the front foot.. For practicing Hitch Kick as a/an intermediate performance, the recommended warm-up exercises are Leg swings with pointed toes, High knees with jump, Broad jumps for 3 repetitions for 5 minutes. After warming up, you should practice the following instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart., Kick leading leg forward, knee straight., Hop on supporting leg, bending knee., Kick trailing leg forward, knee straight., Land on trailing leg, leading leg in front. for 3 repetitions for 5 minutes. Since you want to particularly focus on stability, additional exercises could include Plank holds, Single-leg balance, Bosu ball balance.

Chaine Leaps is a series of jumps in which the skater alternates between the front and back legs.. For practicing Chaine Leaps as a/an advanced performance, the recommended warm-up exercises are Grand jeté, Chaine turn to sauté arabesque, Chaine turn to sauté attitude for 3 repetitions for 5 minutes. After warming up, you should practice the following instructions: Start in B-plus position., Perform a chaine turn, swinging arms with precision., Push off the back leg, leaping with high straight legs., Land on the front leg, bending knees., Flow seamlessly into the next chaine leap. for 3 repetitions for 5 minutes. Since you want to particularly focus on stability, additional exercises could include Plank holds, Single-leg balance, Bosu ball balance.
